conclusion: Analyze the flow paths from points A, B, and C to predict which container the liquid will flow into.
Liquid flows downward from A and encounters a baffle.
The baffle at A directs the flow to the right.
Liquid flows downward from B and encounters a baffle.
The baffle at B directs the flow to the left.
Liquid flows downward from C and encounters a baffle.
The baffle at C directs the flow to the right.
After being directed to the right from A, the liquid continues downward and flows into container E.
After being directed to the left from B, the liquid continues downward and flows into container D.
After being directed to the right from C, the liquid continues downward and flows into container E.
Liquid from A and C will flow into container E.
Liquid from B will flow into container D.
Final answer: Container D receives liquid from B; Container E receives liquid from A and C.
